text: well this week of turmoil in the US
began with that horrific video of George
Floyd a black man struggling to breathe
while being knelt on by a white police
officer since there hundreds of other
videos and testimony have followed
detailing police violence and
discrimination across America New York
State Senator Zell nor miry was hit tear
gassed and handcuffed during a peaceful
protest here he describes what happened
instead of being met with peace I was
met with pepper spray
I was compliant I was listening to
orders I was moving back as I was told
got hit in my leg and my back with
bicycles that the officers had
weaponized was forcefully put my hands
behind my back and and subsequently
pepper sprayed and I have never been
arrested have never been pepper sprayed
and the first time that this happened to
me was as a state senator protesting
police brutality I wore a bright green
neon shirt with my name and title on the
back precisely to de-escalate a
situation just like this and so I
informed them of who I was they saw my
shirt and still proceeded to be
aggressive and there are any number of
statistics at city state and national
level that detailed the racial
disparities that exist in u.s. policing
and the US justice system for example
here's the New York Times reporting the
Minneapolis police use force against
black people at seven times the rate of
whites and you can see that graph which
shows how black people make up 19
percent of the city's population
but 58 percent of times that police use
force it's directed towards African

everything you shouldn't do when it

a probe into Minneapolis Police

generations deep and then there's the

police shootings disproportionately
killed black people in 2019 African
Americans made up around 13% of the u.s.
population but 23
those killed in a police shooting that
year were african-american the
statistics for previous years were
similar also you can see why people are
far less likely to be killed by the
police
there's also racial injustice playing
out in America's prisons African
Americans are imprisoned at five times
the rate of white Americans and almost
two times the rate of Hispanic Americans
and force used by u.s. police officers
has been on display all week this was in

this is an NYPD car driving into a crowd
in Brooklyn on Saturday New York's Mayor

that he never wants to see something
like that he also said that the behavior

course we don't have the police side of

well I'm very concerned you know there
are particularly some of the the clips

in Camden
we started with policy but but cultural

if you don't have the training and the

we have forced as our absolute last
resort and part of our policy is we

so even when even though officers will
engage people and use force if we did
not see that they took an active effort

our policy is subject to disciplinary

week we've seen protestors urging police
to walk with them to take the knee with

we are a long way from a point where all
